headline: Why GMS Stock Crushed It This Week
summary: Lately, GMS (NYSE: GMS) has done very well on the stock market for a company that'll soon cease to be an independent business.  The building products distributor was acquired by a high-profile peer after a brief bidding war, which in combination with several analyst price target bumps gave its shares a real lift.  On Monday, it was announced that a division of SRS Distribution, a subsidiary of DIY goods retailer Home Depot, swooped in to acquire GMS.

headline: Home Depot Stock Picks Momentum in 3 Months: Buy Now or Stay Put?
summary: HD's fundamentals stay strong, with rising Pro sales, supply-chain gains and tech upgrades supporting long-term growth.

headline: Is It Worth Investing in Home Depot (HD) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
summary: According to the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), one should invest in Home Depot (HD). It is debatable whether this highly sought-after metric is effective because Wall Street analysts' recommendations tend to be overly optimistic. Would it be worth investing in the stock?

headline: Truist Reaffirms Buy Rating as Home Depot Targets Pro Segment with GMS Deal
summary: The Home Depot, Inc. (NYSE:HD) ranks among the best set-it-and-forget-it stocks to buy. Truist Securities kept its $417 price target and Buy rating on The Home Depot, Inc. (NYSE:HD) on June 23 in response to the retailer’s roughly $5 billion offer to buy specialist construction materials distributor GMS. According to Truist’s repo, the GMS acquisition […]

headline: Jim Cramer Says “Go With Home Depot”
summary: The Home Depot, Inc. (NYSE:HD) is one of the 25 stocks Jim Cramer recently shared insights on. During the episode, Cramer showed bullish sentiment toward the stock as he said: “I say go with Home Depot.
